MenueSystem

Class Menue

  • java.lang.Object
    • MenueSystem.Panel
      • MenueSystem.Menue

  • public class Menue
extends Panel
    Will Manage and maintain a list of buttons in addition to Panels
    Author:
    Michael Letter

    • Constructor Detail

        public Menue()

    • Method Detail

      • addButton

        public int addButton(Button targetButton)
        Will add a given button as member of this Menu This will resize and reposition the button to match to fit the menue. This will also call autoUpdateTextScale(). This Button can be retrieved with getSubPanel()
        Parameters:
        targetButton - the button to be added
        Returns:
        if positive: represents the current button number, if negative: operation failed nothing is changed.

      • removePanel

        public boolean removePanel(int targetPanelLocation)
        Description copied from class: Panel
        Will attempt to remove the given Panel and all of its sub Panels from this Tree
        Overrides:
        removePanel in class Panel
        Parameters:
        targetPanelLocation - the location of the target Panel relative to this Panel
        Returns:
        if TRUE: removeTarget was removed successfully, if FALSE: removeTarget was not removed and no changes were made

      • getButtonPadding

        public Vector2 getButtonPadding()
        The Vector describing space between the buttons and the outer edges of the Panel is returned by this function
        Returns:
        paddings around the button.

      • setButtonSizesPositions

        public void setButtonSizesPositions(boolean vertical)
        Will Reposition and Rescale all Buttons added using addButton() to fit within this Menue
        Parameters:
        vertical - if TRUE, Buttons will be placed in a vertical line. if FALSE, buttons wil be placed in a horizontal line

      • isSubPanelMenueButton

        public boolean isSubPanelMenueButton(int buttonPosition)
        Will return true if the subPanl at the given position is indeed a button in this menu
        Parameters:
        buttonPosition - subPanl in question
        Returns:
        if TRUE, if the subPanl at the given position is indeed a button in this menu. otherwise FALSE
